messages: f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (00:46): takkaria - start citing the whatwg wiki in the Issues tracker. the more you make use of it, the more others will as well.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:53): btw in case any edit wars turn up on the whatwg wiki - feel free to create whatever pages you want; if two people disagree about how a page should exist on the whatwg wiki, then fork it and both maintain an independent copy
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:53): it's just a scratch space
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (00:56): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e - that's a good start for documenting multiple points of view.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:56): Is there a page on the whatwg wiki documenting the summary issue?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:56): not to my knowledge
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): christ, www-font makes public-html look positively friendly
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:57): goes to create a "Table Summary" page
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:58): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, do you recall what evidence the proponents for summary="" claim supports their position?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:59): The only thing I can think of is that the attribute is read out by default in some screen readers
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:59): the PFWG has consensus on the idea that summary="" is successful
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:59): yeah, but what's that consensus based on?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:59): maybe there's something in the esw wiki about it.
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:00): That's like having consensus that the Roman Empire never fell.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:00): It didn't.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:00): the consensus is based on the expert opinions of their constituents, i believe
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:01): so it's an appeal to authority, who's consensus is itself based on an appeal to authority?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:01): digg is weird
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:02): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Looking at the HTML 5 codec thing?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:02): article "Decoding the HTML 5 video codec debate - Ars Technica" has the following link suggested as "related by keyword": "5 Bizarre Sexual Conditions That Can Ruin Your Life"
57551cb51d38c51417f5abfeacfb9b13 (01:03): 5. Discussing video codecs in bed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:04): i can't scroll the digg comments page in safari
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:04): it keeps scrolling back to the top
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:04): wtf
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:04): i hate digg
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:04): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Any interesting replies to my comments?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:05): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, I don't see any
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:05): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Do you have all threads expanded?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:07): i was just looking to see who was trashtalking me, but it turned out to me someone who's comments are all paranoid rants, so i didn't feel the need to investigate further :-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:07): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, I do now. There's some responses to you
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:08): "Ian Hickson is personally responsible for the failure of the video tag, because he has made too many enemies in all three camps..." :-D
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:08): check out the guy's other comments though

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:09): this one? "Well apparently Ian Hickson has somehow acheived the post where he is personally responsible for HTML 5, and he routeinly trash talks all the other members of the committee. I don't understand how that happened, but this is mostly a result of push back on this Ian Hickson character..."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:09): i mean other comments in other threads
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:09): oh, here? http://digg.com/users/B1665r
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:10): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:10): it strikes me that saying that he only writes paranoid rants is not going to help me any in convincing him that i don't trashtalk people regularly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:11): though he wouldn't have known i was talking abotu him if you hadn't pasted what he wrote and his username into the channel :-P
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:12): just get krijnh to clean up the logs and he'll never know
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:12): i don't hide my words :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:13): I just talk incoherently, and claim not to use words.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:13): Though I guess UAX #29 would disagree
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:15): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, no-one ever knows what you're talking about anyway :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:15): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: esp. on Twitter
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:17): LOL, some of these rationale for including summary="" from the esw wiki are funny.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:18): "19. Including @summary solves a real problem."
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:18): "20. Including @summary removes an obstacle to accessibility advocates promoting the use of HTML5."

f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:23): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 - perhaps the [citation-required] template/convention of Wikipedia would be useful for claims that are made without supporting evidence.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:24): f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905, unfortunately, the esw wiki seems to lack any useful templates like that
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:24): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, but you could introduce such templates into the whatwg wiki
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:24): yeah, that would be possible
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:24): and thus continue your fork of the Table Summary page there with more diligence
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:25): pedantic correction: it's {{Citation needed}}

f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:25): regarding "PFWG has consensus on the idea that summary="" is successful" - it is better (more scientific) to document data/opinions, even bad data / opinions, and debunk it, than not to document it at all.
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:26): debunk *them* (them being the opinions as it were, not the people)
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:26): if necesary, label opinions as "appeal to authority", or "based on personal anecdote" etc., whatever you think is the appropriate critique.
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:27): because even data based on personal anecdote is better than no data.
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:27): it just has be considered with the appropriate weight relative to other kinds of data (data on studies of a hundred websites for example)

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:31): I'm not going to copy and paste most of the existing content. I think a better approach is to sift through the existing page and e-mail archives and simply document any supported claims, preferably with citations for each
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:32): But not tonight. I'm getting quite tired.
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:33): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 yes that seems reasonable

f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (01:34): There may also be value in documenting which claims are *unsupported* in a separate section, just to highlight the fact that the claims are unsupported - so that if such claims are reiterated in email - you can follow-up with the response that the claim is unsupported per URL.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:34): I started the page. http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Table_Summary
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (01:35): feel free to continue with it and I'll try and get back to it tomorrow evening
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:35): what's it for?
